fields_of_interest: Trade, Consumers, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Food Safety, Fraud prevention
eu_initiatives:
On 7 May 2018, TRACIT will be launching in Brussels an Illicit Trade Environmental Index. The initiative has been developed in partnership with The Economist Group.  
 
For this event, TRACIT is seeking the participation as of EU officials as panelists. These officials will be asked to provide their perspective on illicit trade in the context of the findings of the Index.
organisation_name: Transnational Alliance to Combat Illicit Trade (TRACIT)
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership: TRACIT is not a member to any body.
goals__remit: The Transnational Alliance to Combat Illicit Trade (TRACIT) is an independent, business-led initiative to mitigate the economic and social damages of illicit trade by strengthening government enforcement mechanisms and integrating supply chain controls across industry sectors.
relevant_communication:
The Illicit Trade Environmental Index will be TRACIT's  first "official" publication.  
 
TRACIT regularly issues press releases following its participation on global anti illicit trade fora, including the OECD Task Force on Illicit Trade. All of its press releases are available on TRACIT's website
legal_status: non-governmental, not-for-profit organisation under US tax code 501(c)(6)
